intro: Viola vicina, commonly known as the common violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of purple or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, shady environments. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and the plant is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Viola vicina is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in traditional remedies.
